transformation.definition: A transfer occurs when ethical tensions are resolved by clarifying how existing principles apply to new circumstances
transformation.reasoning: The case transfers established principles of responsible charge and professional judgment to the new context of AI tool usage

initial_state.description: Uncertainty about how traditional engineering ethics apply to AI-assisted practice
tensions: Efficiency vs. thoroughness in AI output review

final_state.description: Clarified application of existing principles to AI context
resolutions: Responsible charge requirements apply equally to AI-generated work
Technology is a tool, not a substitute for judgment
Confidentiality obligations extend to AI data handling

key_principles_applied.traditional_application: Active engagement in work from conception to completion
key_principles_applied.ai_context_application: Engineer must critically evaluate and understand AI outputs before acceptance
AI outputs brought under control through thorough review and verification
Understanding AI tool limitations is part of competent use

precedent_continuity.from: BER Case 90-6 (CADD systems) and BER Case 98-3 (CD-ROM design tools)
precedent_continuity.to: Current AI language and drafting tools
precedent_continuity.principle_preserved: Technology must not replace engineering judgment
